result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Wanya Timothy Johnson

records.addlTxt: Defendant Wanya Timothy Johnson in court with attorney Andrew Joel Golden.  Daniel T Flaherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Case DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing for 2022CF600.

Attorney Andrew Joel Golden in court, defendant Wanya Timothy Johnson not in court, in custody.  
Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Status conference held.  Defendant has a pending felony case and Atty. Golden is still getting discovery on this matter.  Court authorizes transfer of this case to Br. 4 for global resolution only.  Case is adjourned to Br. 1.  Status conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Letter from defendant re:  PR Bond.   (Wanya Johnson - #2022001902, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

Defendant Wanya Timothy Johnson not in court, defendant in custody.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
OFF THE RECORD.  Matter set for pretrial conference.  The SPD office has not been able to appoint counsel and requests another date.  Status conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with JRR, BDS, JBS
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Wanya Timothy Johnson in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Wanya Timothy Johnson in custody.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
